intro: Payena thorelii, commonly known as the African ebony, is a tropical evergreen tree native to western and central Africa. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae and is characterized by its dark, dense wood, which is highly valued for its durability and fine grain. The plant has simple, opposite leaves that are elliptical in shape and often have a glossy appearance. It produces small, clustered flowers that are typically white or yellowish, followed by dark, spherical berries. Payena thorelii is also known for its medicinal properties, with various parts of the plant used in traditional African medicine.
